metadata.synopsis: Ulma, the leader of Gur Tribe, talks to the player while Astarion is not around. If Gandrel (Gur Hunter from Act 1) is alive, also present. Ulma speaks in an accented lilt - English is not her first language.Scene Trigger - WYR_GurCamp_Intro_SceneTrigger_8c9acc78-9d97-4d0f-919e-3997c015ed7f
metadata.how_to_trigger: Ctrl+Shift+7 (Origin Debug Book)Astarion - Origin Moments - Gur Camp

14.speaker: Ulma
14.text: If you will not help us, we do not need you here.
14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking onto a pyre, where a variety of possessions are being burned - armour and broken weapons, as well as clothing, NodeContext: REK tay ee HATH-ran ROOST

51.speaker: Ulma
51.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking onto a pyre, where a variety of possessions are being burned - armour and broken weapons, as well as clothing, NodeContext: REK tay ee HATH-ran ROOST

28.speaker: Player
28.text: *You recognise the words - Gur funeral rites. To hear them is rare: the Gur monster hunters are as formidable as they are secretive.*
28.context: NodeContext: FREY vald isk dur-OF-nah. FREY vald isk ab-LAST

74.text: *You recognise the words - Gur funeral rites. To hear them is rare: the Gur monster hunters are as formidable as they are secretive.*
74.context: NodeContext: FREY vald isk dur-OF-nah. FREY vald isk ab-LAST

9.speaker: Narrator
9.text: *You recognise the words - Gur funeral rites. To hear them is rare: the Gur monster hunters are as formidable as they are secretive.*
9.context: NodeContext: FREY vald isk dur-OF-nah. FREY vald isk ab-LAST

159.speaker: Gandrel
159.text: My friend from the hag swamp? You are a bright light on a dark day.
159.context: NodeContext: FREY vald isk dur-OF-nah. FREY vald isk ab-LAST

85.speaker: Player
85.context: NodeContext: FREY vald isk dur-OF-nah. FREY vald isk ab-LAST

167.speaker: Gandrel
167.text: We underestimated an enemy. Much like I underestimated you and your vampiric companion.

42.speaker: Gandrel
42.text: Oh yes, I know you hid him from me. But this is not the moment to discuss it. This is about the dead, not the undead.

1.speaker: Player
1.context: NodeContext: FREY vald isk dur-OF-nah. FREY vald isk ab-LAST

162.speaker: Gandrel
162.text: Prayers for the fallen - we are burning their belongings so they may fight on in the next life. Battling monsters like your pale friend, perhaps.
162.context: NodeContext: FREY vald isk dur-OF-nah. FREY vald isk ab-LAST

8.speaker: Gandrel
8.text: Prayers for the fallen. We are burning their belongings so they may fight on in the afterlife.
8.context: NodeContext: FREY vald isk dur-OF-nah. FREY vald isk ab-LAST

197.speaker: Ulma
197.text: Frey vald isk durovna. Frey vald isk ablast.
197.context: NodeContext: FREY vald isk dur-OF-nah. FREY vald isk ab-LAST

65.speaker: Gandrel
65.text: Our tribe left camp on a rescue mission. Only Ulma and those you see here returned.
65.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nodding to Ulma, the camp matriach, standing in front of him. She's by a funeral pyre, leading prayers, so a small distance away

145.speaker: Player
145.text: Did they save whoever they set out to rescue?
145.context: NodeContext: IM or-AK nay tay. KRAS-in nay TRAH

32.speaker: Gandrel
32.context: NodeContext: IM or-AK nay tay. KRAS-in nay TRAH

151.speaker: Ulma
151.text: Im orak ne tay. Krasin ne trah!
151.context: NodeContext: IM or-AK nay tay. KRAS-in nay TRAH

47.speaker: Gandrel
47.text: I will say no more. It is not my tale to tell.
47.context: CinematicNodeContext: Approaching the players from the direction of the campfireNodeContext: Approaching the players from the direction of the campfire

45.speaker: Ulma
45.text: No, that shame is mine alone.
45.context: CinematicNodeContext: Approaching the players from the direction of the campfireNodeContext: Approaching the players from the direction of the campfire

27.speaker: Ulma
27.text: I thought I knew the faces of all your friends, Gandrel, but this one is new to me.
27.context: InternalNodeContext: 'friend' and 'stranger' refer to the player

11.speaker: Ulma
11.text: I thought I knew the faces of all your friends, Gandrel, but this one is new to me.
11.context: InternalNodeContext: 'friend' and 'stranger' refer to the player

114.speaker: Player
114.context: InternalNodeContext: 'friend' and 'stranger' refer to the player

199.speaker: Gandrel
199.text: A friend met on the road, my lady. I told you of the stranger in the swamp?
199.context: InternalNodeContext: 'friend' and 'stranger' refer to the player

44.speaker: Player
44.text: I didn't know this was a funeral. I'm sorry for your loss.

196.speaker: Ulma
196.text: Those who have left us will be celebrated, not mourned. They died well, after all.

21.speaker: Gandrel
21.text: And this is the one I spoke of, my lady - the stranger I met while hunting the spawn.

98.speaker: Gandrel
98.text: They killed not only that fen's hag, but also the undying General Thorm, if the rumours are true.

54.speaker: Ulma
54.text: Two fine trophies. Perhaps I can interest you in a third?

89.speaker: Player
89.text: Perhaps. What do you have in mind?

18.speaker: Ulma
18.text: Baldur's Gate is haunted by many things, but one of its most insidious is the vampire Cazador.

153.speaker: Ulma
153.text: For years, his foul spawn have stolen away innocents at night, whisking them back to his palace. Recently, they struck our camp.

134.speaker: Ulma
134.text: They took our children. Every last one - our whole future.

204.speaker: Gandrel
204.text: We are monster hunters all - our purpose is to kill beasts like these. But in our haste to save our little ones, we were rash. We charged straight into an ambush.

203.speaker: Ulma
203.text: They tore us to pieces - vampire spawn and werewolves - I have never seen a vampire's lair so heavily guarded.

13.speaker: Ulma
13.text: What's left of my tribe is wounded and broken - we cannot stand against him to save our children. But perhaps the slayer of Ketheric could?

175.speaker: Player
175.context: NodeContext: Stress on 'this', a little shocked/annoyed

64.speaker: Ulma
64.text: A noble goal. I will not ask you to deviate from it, but know that this city holds other dangers too.
64.context: NodeContext: Stress on 'this', a little shocked/annoyed

99.speaker: Ulma
99.text: In the city lives Cazador Szarr, a powerful man - a respected man. A man known to host lavish, hedonistic banquets in his palace.
99.context: NodeContext: Stress on 'this', a little shocked/annoyed

112.speaker: Ulma
112.text: But behind the façade, there is a monster. A vampire who has made Baldur's Gate a feeding ground and his palace an abattoir.
112.context: NodeContext: Stress on 'this', a little shocked/annoyed

171.speaker: Ulma
171.text: We suspect he holds his victims somewhere below his mansion. And we fear our missing children are among them.
171.context: NodeContext: Stress on 'this', a little shocked/annoyed

189.speaker: Ulma
189.text: We tried to save them and paid a heavy price. But perhaps the slayer of Ketheric could succeed where we failed?
189.context: NodeContext: Stress on 'this', a little shocked/annoyed

176.speaker: Gandrel
176.text: I admit, I am surprised. I thought your pale companion would kill for a chance to face his old master.
176.context: NodeContext: Stress on 'this', a little shocked/annoyed

58.speaker: Ulma
58.text: This is the one who hid the spawn from you?
58.context: NodeContext: Stress on 'this', a little shocked/annoyed

31.speaker: Player
31.text: Astarion isn't responsible for the crimes Cazador forced him to commit.

96.speaker: Gandrel
96.text: A vampire spawn is doubly cursed - first to be a slave, but still to be a monster. He is not so innocent.

101.speaker: Ulma
101.text: No, but he may be useful.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: I thought you were going to kill him!

17.speaker: Gandrel
17.text: I admit, I would have relished it. But his death would not have served us well.

130.speaker: Ulma
130.text: The spawn can infiltrate Cazador's palace in a way we never could. And he could take you with him.

94.speaker: Ulma
94.text: Together you could save those stolen from us and help your companion destroy his old master. We would all be free.

169.speaker: Ulma
169.text: If you do this, our entire tribe will be in your debt. On our honour, it will be repaid.

77.speaker: Ulma
77.text: May the gods keep you and damn your enemies.

183.speaker: Player
183.text: How am I meant to get in if this palace is so well guarded?

155.speaker: Ulma
155.text: The main entrance is blockaded, but there is another way. Near the park, you will find a broken tower, mid-repair. Climb the scaffolding and you can enter his palace.

137.speaker: Ulma
137.text: It may be watched, but you will not walk into the slaughter that we did.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: And if it's too late to save your children?

180.speaker: Ulma
180.text: Then we will settle for blood.

111.speaker: Ulma
111.text: Cazador must be destroyed. For the safety of the city, and to make sure no one else must feel our pain.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: I'll chop him into so many bits you won't know he was a vampire.

136.speaker: Player
136.text: I have other battles to fight.

142.speaker: Ulma
142.text: Very well, but I pray you do not save yourself from one terror only to fall to the next.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: Please, will you take him now? He's so annoying.

87.speaker: Ulma
87.text: Alas, now he is more valuable with you.

24.speaker: Ulma
24.text: Slay the vampire, claim his head, and free our children. Please.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: I'll see what can be done.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: I'm sorry for your loss, but I have my own fight.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: Yeah, I'm definitely not doing that.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: I take no pride in killing nor trophies from it. Sometimes it simply must be done.

190.speaker: Ulma
190.text: It is a solemn task - one this city forces us to undertake time and again.

141.speaker: Gandrel
141.text: And they went on to kill the undying General Thorm, if the rumours are true.

108.speaker: Ulma
108.text: A fine trophy. Perhaps you would like to claim another?

191.speaker: Player
191.text: You said those rites beautifully - I'm sorry for your loss.

160.speaker: Player
160.text: Gandrel was just telling me how you got your arse kicked.

115.speaker: Ulma
115.text: Crude, but not untrue. And who is this, Gandrel?

93.speaker: Gandrel
93.text: A risk was taken. Unfortunately, it led to disaster.

166.speaker: Player
166.text: So... did you ever find that vampire spawn?

192.speaker: Gandrel
192.text: I did not. Although I suspect you knew that much already.

133.speaker: Gandrel
133.text: I did not. He slipped by me, although how I do not know.

174.speaker: Player
174.text: I pledge your dead my respects - your quarry must have been impressive.

156.speaker: Gandrel
156.text: I see you have studied our tongue, friend. You are quite correct - we underestimated an enemy.

80.speaker: Gandrel
80.text: Welcome, friend. You find us on a solemn day.

179.speaker: Gandrel
179.text: There is no need - all are welcome to remember the fallen.

121.speaker: Ulma
121.text: *She's speaking the language of the Gur people, one influenced by ancient Rashemi tongues. She's praying for the fallen of her tribe as their possessions are burned.*
121.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ulma pauses for a moment, staring at the fire in contemplation before she turns and walks over to the player.

105.speaker: Player
105.text: *She's speaking the language of the Gur people, one influenced by ancient Rashemi tongues. She's praying for the fallen of her tribe as their possessions are burned.*
105.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ulma pauses for a moment, staring at the fire in contemplation before she turns and walks over to the player.

20.speaker: Narrator
20.text: *She's speaking the language of the Gur people, one influenced by ancient Rashemi tongues. She's praying for the fallen of her tribe as their possessions are burned.*
20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ulma pauses for a moment, staring at the fire in contemplation before she turns and walks over to the player.

67.speaker: Narrator
67.text: *She's speaking the language of the Gur people, one influenced by ancient Rashemi tongues. She's praying for the fallen of her tribe as their possessions are burned.*
67.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ulma pauses for a moment, staring at the fire in contemplation before she turns and walks over to the player.

161.text: I do not know if showing your face here is brave or stupid, given the company you keep.
161.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ulma pauses for a moment, staring at the fire in contemplation before she turns and walks over to the player.

150.text: I do not know if showing your face here is brave or stupid, given the company you keep.

36.speaker: Ulma
36.text: I do not know if showing your face here is brave or stupid, given the company you keep.

188.speaker: Ulma
188.text: Do you even know the sins of the one you travel with? The one you protect?

187.speaker: Player
187.text: You'll have to be more specific - I know some interesting people.

88.speaker: Ulma
88.text: You have travelled with Astarion, a spawn sired and raised by the vampire Cazador.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: I know the Gur people have a history with a vampire spawn named Astarion.

68.speaker: Ulma
68.text: Yes, we are familiar with Astarion.

26.speaker: Ulma
26.text: The same Astarion that came in the night with his wretched siblings and stole away my tribe's children.

6.speaker: Ulma
6.text: The same Astarion who killed our kin Gandrel and left him to rot in a hag's swamp.

140.speaker: Ulma
140.text: His crimes against my people are legion. His name is cursed on our lips.

146.speaker: Ulma
146.text: But even so, there are others whose crimes are greater.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: Lady, I have no idea who you are.

184.speaker: Ulma
184.text: I am Ulma, leader of what remains of my tribe. Your vampiric friend stole away our children, and we have lost many trying to save them.

7.speaker: Ulma
7.text: But alas, taking our revenge on him would likely doom us all.

154.speaker: Ulma
154.text: I would make peace with your Astarion. I would forgive him his sins if we can reach an accord.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: You'll forgive the person who stole your children?

39.speaker: Ulma
39.text: The children of my tribe were taken from us. Stolen in the night and brought to Cazador's palace by your friend and his siblings.

29.speaker: Ulma
29.text: We tried to save them, but his palace was too well defended.

10.speaker: Ulma
10.text: We were not able to save our children, but perhaps one of his own - your Astarion - could enter safely, destroy Cazador, and save them?

173.speaker: Player
173.text: All right, I'll talk to Astarion.

2.speaker: Ulma
2.text: My thanks. I only pray his anger at his old master burns as brightly as ours.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: What can you tell me about Cazador's lair?

157.speaker: Ulma
157.text: Less than I'd like. We made it to the main hall before his slaves attacked.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: And why in the hells would Astarion take you up on this?

3.speaker: Ulma
3.text: Perhaps he will not. Perhaps he is the monster we believe him to be.

0.speaker: Ulma
0.text: But if he is not, he has a chance to do some good today. To set right a little of the pain he has caused in his miserable existence.

110.speaker: Player
110.text: He won't make a deal with you and neither will I.

102.speaker: Ulma
102.text: A pity. You had a chance to cleanse his hands of some blood.

178.speaker: Ulma
178.text: But I will enjoy ridding this world of one more monster.

152.speaker: Player
152.text: I don't travel with Astarion anymore. He's long gone.

118.speaker: Ulma
118.text: Can it be true? Perhaps you are more powerful than I give you credit for.

81.speaker: Ulma
81.text: If you have taken one undead trophy, perhaps I can interest you in another?

56.speaker: Player
56.text: Maybe Gandrel didn't leave him much choice.

116.speaker: Ulma
116.text: Gandrel was doing his duty, trying to save our tribe's future.

158.speaker: Ulma
158.text: But no matter - he is gone and the past is done. I wish to discuss the future.

186.speaker: Player
186.text: In Astarion's defence, the look on Gandrel's face as he died was priceless.

181.speaker: Ulma
181.text: I thought perhaps we could talk, but no. There is no common ground here.

170.speaker: Ulma
170.text: You are a roach upon the world. It will be a pleasure to stamp you out.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: Oh, they're nothing compared to my sins.

143.speaker: Ulma
143.text: This may be true, but your sins have not been visited upon us. Unlike your campmate Astarion.

194.speaker: Ulma
194.text: We would not normally tolerate outsiders at a time like this.

124.speaker: Ulma
124.text: The slayer of Ketheric Thorm? Well, these are strange times indeed.

70.speaker: Ulma
70.text: My thanks. We grieve those who left us, but celebrate them too. They died well.

139.speaker: Ulma
139.text: There is doom in the air these days, but welcome news too. Word has reached me that the undying Ketheric Thorm is destroyed.

86.speaker: Ulma
86.text: And if whispered tales can be believed, he was defeated by one looking much like you.

104.speaker: Ulma
104.text: The head of the shadow-cursed warlord is an impressive trophy. I am wondering if I could tempt you with another.

182.speaker: Player
182.text: I'm just a traveller - I've never heard of this 'Ketheric', let alone killed him.

148.speaker: Ulma
148.text: No? A pity - the head of the shadow-cursed warlord would have made a fine trophy.

52.speaker: Ulma
52.text: But perhaps I can interest you in claiming another prize?

202.speaker: Ulma
202.text: You find us honouring our dead. Celebrating those who fell in battle trying to save our tribe.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: Speak the traditional Rashemi blessing for fallen warriors.

193.speaker: Ulma
193.text: Thank you, kin. You honour our fallen in these dark times.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Well, here I am. What are you going to do about it?

195.speaker: Ulma
195.text: Nothing, for these are not normal times.

177.text: *You recognise the language of the Gur people, sprinkled with words from ancient Rashemi tongues, but you cannot follow what's being said.*

135.speaker: Narrator
135.text: *You recognise the language of the Gur people, sprinkled with words from ancient Rashemi tongues, but you cannot follow what's being said.*

90.speaker: Player
90.text: *You recognise the funeral rites of the Gur people - famed monster hunters. She's burning the possessions of those who have fallen.*

91.speaker: Narrator
91.text: *You recognise the funeral rites of the Gur people - famed monster hunters. She's burning the possessions of those who have fallen.*

113.speaker: Narrator
113.text: *You recognise the funeral rites of the Gur people - famed monster hunters. She's burning the possessions of those who have fallen.*

73.text: *You've clearly walked into some kind of ceremony, but it's nothing that you recognise.*

92.speaker: Narrator
92.text: *You've clearly walked into some kind of ceremony, but it's nothing that you recognise.*

147.speaker: Ulma
147.text: We await an audience with your spawn.

198.speaker: Ulma
198.text: Do not stand here and wait - Cazador must be destroyed!
